textBeforeTable: Patent Citations Examples were also tested wherein the materials were cured in the isotropic state after flow filling in the isotropic state. For the examples contained in FIGS. 2-7, all of those that were cured were flow filled, thermally cycled and cured in the SC phase under a UV lamp with no field applied. The initiator used was Darocur 1173 (approximately 0.1%). FIGS. 2-7 illustrate the appearance of liquid crystal cells viewed under a microscope before and after they had been subjected to mechanical shock. Typically cells were 1.5-2.0 μm thick for these experiments, though cells of any suitable thickness could have been used.
